name: undelegate
title: .undelegate()
desc: Remove a handler from the event for all elements which match the current selector, based upon a specific set of root elements.

argument.desc: A selector which will be used to filter the event results.
argument.name: selector

argument.desc: A string containing a JavaScript event type, such as "click" or "keydown"
argument.name: eventType

argument.desc: A selector which will be used to filter the event results.
argument.name: selector

argument.desc: A string containing a JavaScript event type, such as "click" or "keydown"
argument.name: eventType

argument.desc: A function to execute at the time the event is triggered.
argument.name: handler(eventObject)

argument.desc: A selector which will be used to filter the event results.
argument.name: selector

argument.desc: An object of one or more event types and previously bound functions to unbind from them.
argument.name: events

argument.desc: A string containing a namespace to unbind all events from.
argument.name: namespace

examples.desc: Can bind and unbind events to the colored button.
examples.html: Click!

entries.longdesc: The .undelegate() method is a way of removing event handlers that have been bound using .delegate(). As of jQuery 1.7, the .on() and .off() methods are preferred for attaching and removing event handlers.
